DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Lysis Syndrome Initiation Intervention Management Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes or no indicator weather therapy was initiated and managed for tumor lysis syndrome.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Lysis Syndrome Initiation Intervention or Procedure Administration, Management
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A condition of metabolic abnormalities that result from a spontaneous or therapy-related cytolysis of tumor cells. Tumor lysis syndrome typically occurs in aggressive, rapidly proliferating lymphoproliferative disorders. Burkitt lymphoma and T cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia are commonly associated with this syndrome. Metabolic abnormalities include hyperuricemia, lactic acidosis, hyperkalemia, hyperphosphatemia and hypocalcemia and may result in renal failure, multiple organ failure, and death._The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition of metabolic abnormalities that result from a spontaneous or therapy-related cytolysis of tumor cells. Tumor lysis syndrome typically occurs in aggressive, rapidly proliferating lymphoproliferative disorders. Burkitt lymphoma and T cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia are commonly associated with this syndrome. Metabolic abnormalities include hyperuricemia, lactic acidosis, hyperkalemia, hyperphosphatemia and hypocalcemia and may result in renal failure, multiple organ failure, and death.

Concepts.definition: A condition of metabolic abnormalities that result from a spontaneous or therapy-related cytolysis of tumor cells. Tumor lysis syndrome typically occurs in aggressive, rapidly proliferating lymphoproliferative disorders. Burkitt lymphoma and T cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia are commonly associated with this syndrome. Metabolic abnormalities include hyperuricemia, lactic acidosis, hyperkalemia, hyperphosphatemia and hypocalcemia and may result in renal failure, multiple organ failure, and death.

Property.preferredName: Initiation Intervention or Procedure Administration, Management

This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.

Concepts.definition: The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.
